DataElement.preferredName: Pain Assessment Verbal Analog Scale 10 Point Likert Scale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's verbal evaluation of pain on a scale from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The evaluation of pain complaints.  Measurements should be objective on the part of the practitioner, based on subjective information from the patient.  Measurements may also be indirect, by such assessments as respiratory rate and effort, withdrawal, guarding, or other appropriate assessment techniques._A pain rating scale that includes specific pain criteria and self-reported ratings based upon patient verbalizations.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The evaluation of pain complaints.  Measurements should be objective on the part of the practitioner, based on subjective information from the patient.  Measurements may also be indirect, by such assessments as respiratory rate and effort, withdrawal, guarding, or other appropriate assessment techniques.

Concepts.definition: The evaluation of pain complaints.  Measurements should be objective on the part of the practitioner, based on subjective information from the patient.  Measurements may also be indirect, by such assessments as respiratory rate and effort, withdrawal, guarding, or other appropriate assessment techniques.

Property.preferredDefinition: A pain rating scale that includes specific pain criteria and self-reported ratings based upon patient verbalizations.

Concepts.definition: A pain rating scale that includes specific pain criteria and self-reported ratings based upon patient verbalizations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings._A number with no fractional part.::10_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Pain Integer::10 Point Likert Scale Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:A number with no fractional part.::10:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.

A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University clinical trial
